<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><items termsofuse="https://boardgamegeek.com/xmlapi/termsofuse"><item type="boardgamefamily" id="123">
         <thumbnail>https://cf.geekdo-images.com/YJ4BwFNUXLn6RGUYfK111Q__thumb/img/yTOHhsfgDVUpL2lU6tnX_ErowIY=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic437116.jpg</thumbnail>
      <image>https://cf.geekdo-images.com/YJ4BwFNUXLn6RGUYfK111Q__original/img/rlP0aZf1ANOd_QFg6RsaYsTw7ME=/0x0/filters:format(jpeg)/pic437116.jpg</image>
                                     				
				<name type="primary" sortindex="1" value="Series: Panzer Grenadier (Avalanche)" />
			
						                           
						               													<description>The Panzer Grenadier series covers platoon-level combat from the 1930's to the early 1950's, with the primary focus on World War Two.  The game scale is 200 meters / hex and 15 min / turn, units are leaders, tank and infantry platoons, heavy weapons batteries, and occasionally aircraft and support vessels.&#10;&#10;The series launched in 1998, with Panzer Grenadier. It has become one of the most popular game series produced by Avalanche Press Ltd., with over a dozen boxed games published supported by many book/folio supplements.&#10;&#10;The Panzer Grenadier series page at Avalanche Press.&#10;&#10;The latest 4th Edition rules (English) including charts and tables are available on the company website, along with a downloadable introductory module.  German and French translations of the earlier 2nd Edition are also posted there.&#10;&#10;Support for the series is available on ConsimWorld.&#10;&#10;A sister series, Series: Infantry Attacks (Avalanche Press), was launched in 2010, and uses a similar game system set in the Great War.  Another sister series, Panzer Grenadier (Modern), debuted in August 2013.  Additional PG themes include the Cold War gone hot in the 1950's (&quot;Iron Curtain&quot;) and the Korean War.  Maps from all series are interchangeable.&#10;&#10;</description>

content:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><items termsofuse="https://boardgamegeek.com/xmlapi/termsofuse"><item type="boardgamefamily" id="123">
         <thumbnail>https://cf.geekdo-images.com/YJ4BwFNUXLn6RGUYfK111Q__thumb/img/yTOHhsfgDVUpL2lU6tnX_ErowIY=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic437116.jpg</thumbnail>
      <image>https://cf.geekdo-images.com/YJ4BwFNUXLn6RGUYfK111Q__original/img/rlP0aZf1ANOd_QFg6RsaYsTw7ME=/0x0/filters:format(jpeg)/pic437116.jpg</image>
                                     				
				<name type="primary" sortindex="1" value="Series: Panzer Grenadier (Avalanche)" />
			
						                           
						               													<description>The Panzer Grenadier series covers platoon-level combat from the 1930's to the early 1950's, with the primary focus on World War Two.  The game scale is 200 meters / hex and 15 min / turn, units are leaders, tank and infantry platoons, heavy weapons batteries, and occasionally aircraft and support vessels.&#10;&#10;The series launched in 1998, with Panzer Grenadier. It has become one of the most popular game series produced by Avalanche Press Ltd., with over a dozen boxed games published supported by many book/folio supplements.&#10;&#10;The Panzer Grenadier series page at Avalanche Press.&#10;&#10;The latest 4th Edition rules (English) including charts and tables are available on the company website, along with a downloadable introductory module.  German and French translations of the earlier 2nd Edition are also posted there.&#10;&#10;Support for the series is available on ConsimWorld.&#10;&#10;A sister series, Series: Infantry Attacks (Avalanche Press), was launched in 2010, and uses a similar game system set in the Great War.  Another sister series, Panzer Grenadier (Modern), debuted in August 2013.  Additional PG themes include the Cold War gone hot in the 1950's (&quot;Iron Curtain&quot;) and the Korean War.  Maps from all series are interchangeable.&#10;&#10;</description>
										      				
		 			

			
		
					<link type="boardgamefamily" id="391728" value="1940: Swallows of Death – Moroccan Troops in the Battle of France" inbound="true"/>
